title: Suspect in deadly Smith County gang shootout takes plea deal
content:
TYLER, TX (KLTV) -
One of the suspects in the Bunny's Truck Stop shooting last year pled guilty in a hearing Thursday morning
D'Mio Ingram pled guilty to deadly conduct, a third-degree felony. His sentence recommendation is six years in prison.
Ingram was facing a murder charge in the death of 25-year-old Laprida Shears. Shears was killed last August outside Bunny's Truck Stop on Farm to Market 14 and N. Loop 323 in Tyler. His charge was reduced from murder to deadly conduct in the plea agreement.
Officers say 70 shots were fired outside the truck stop when an argument broke out between gang members from Longview and Tyler.
